meanings.definition: Capable of making mistakes or errors.
meanings.sent1: She is an errable student who often forgets her homework.
meanings.sent2: It is important to learn from our errable actions and improve.
meanings.sent3: The errable puppy chewed on the wrong shoe again!
meanings.sent4: His errable decisions led him down the wrong path.
meanings.sent5: The errable nature of human beings is what makes us unique.

meanings.definition: Able to be corrected or rectified.
meanings.sent1: The errable mistake in the report was quickly fixed.
meanings.sent2: Fortunately, the error was errable and easily resolved.
meanings.sent3: The errable typo made the sentence quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her attitude was like an errable compass, always pointing towards improvement.
meanings.sent5: With patience and effort, even the most errable situation can be turned around.
